thread_replies.author: 山口貴由
thread_replies.text:
A manga artist who wants to rebind their life.  
When I've serialized seven manga works, one of them ends up becoming a modest hit, like barely a single to first base. I'm not first-rate, but it doesn't bring me any joy to be called second-rate.

thread_replies.author: うす味＠六月攻勢
thread_replies.text:
たしか悟空道の愛蔵版巻末だったかと思いますが(曖昧です)「連載時一言コメントまとめ」みたいなのがありまして、姉に見せたら笑いすぎて失禁してました。
この一事だけで生涯の信頼に足る作家だと確信しております。

thread_replies.author: 社会のボトムズ
thread_replies.text: 超一流が何かおっしゃってる。

thread_replies.author: あの子のLINEが既読にならないしゃか
thread_replies.text:
The fact that they can draw Siguiri already means that the axis of evaluation isn't even on the level of first-rate or second-rate anymore...
It's in a league of its own; no one else can draw that—it's one and only.
Also, the depth of Akita Shoten's tolerance; I don't think

thread_replies.author: 拾いもの
thread_replies.text:
If I were to deliberately describe his works, I think it would be "not the mainstream."
The paths they take are beast trails, shedding light on such people. I continue reading his works, drawn to that dazzling vividness, but for some, it might feel like poison.

thread_replies.author: いわもとそうたつ
thread_replies.text:
Sigurui, I don't get what the world's hits are, but in my life, it's extra edition. It was a grand slam outside the park.  
Gekko Kamen, I always enjoy reading it.
